channel.title: Starting in the actual RSPS scene
channel.description:
Hi all, Two years ago, I made a server with Project Insanity. Built it up from the ground. I want to make a new server, but I have some questions.
[ul][li]What is the best source to start with, stable, easy?[/li] [li]What source is the best for a community around 200 people?[/li][/ul]
Thank you.
Note: My JAVA skills are medium, but i need a runnable server ;)

item.title: Starting in the actual RSPS scene
item.dc:creator: @Owner_Titanan Owner Titanan
item.description:
@Owner_Titanan wrote:

hyperion or runesource all the way. Developed by best developers ever.

Read full topic

Lol go away.

That was advice…

The community is shocking now, it’s hard to actually get a server off the ground, IF it even does because there are too many major servers like soulsplit etc…

leeched servers never get somewhere
[/quote]
Sure they do.[/quote]

some of them :3

item.source: Starting in the actual RSPS scene

item.title: Starting in the actual RSPS scene
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

Delta = PI = wL.

They’re both the same on the inside. The guy who made delta is just an idiot in the fact that he stuffed everything into one freaking class… Tbh PI’s “load” isn’t an accurate measurement of the server load, so don’t go off that. I wouldn’t really recommend Hyperion or Apollo because Graham seriously over-complexes everything, it’s all so redundant. I’d try like Rune-source, or some other user-written base as a start, just look at who wrote it, and that will tell you if it’s good or not. Every server is a good learning experience, but some will hurt you more than others.

Read full topic
item.source: Starting in the actual RSPS scene

item.title: Starting in the actual RSPS scene
item.dc:creator: @cdfles cdfles
item.description:
@cdfles wrote:

marcbob:

Anything you put effort into can get a good amount of players. Pick any server that appeals to you in the downloads section and go from there. If you have creative content then players will flock to your server.

Thank you for your answer, I heard that Delta sucks, but why It is stable in my eyes? PI has too heavy load lol… Tried to run it on my server @ home, but the load with one player is like 15,48% lol… Thats just too high… All deadlocks and so have been fixed, but I know what it is: the player clipping, but without that the server sucks lol

Read full topic
item.source: Starting in the actual RSPS scene

item.description:

Anything you put effort into can get a good amount of players. Pick any server that appeals to you in the downloads section and go from there. If you have creative content then players will flock to your server.

item.title: Starting in the actual RSPS scene
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“ohokay, post:4, topic:518272”][quote author=cdfles link=topic=636535.msg4291462#msg4291462 date=1367336997]
Lol go away.
[/quote]

That was advice…

The community is shocking now, it’s hard to actually get a server off the ground, IF it even does because there are too many major servers like soulsplit etc…[/quote]
It’s not hard to get a server off the ground if you put work into it, if you don’t then you won’t get players; simple as that :P.

Read full topic

item.source: Starting in the actual RSPS scene

item.title: Starting in the actual RSPS scene
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Stick with something like Hyperion, you’ll need to write most of your own skills and content but it’s worth it in the long run. Towards the community, keep it transparent. Don’t keep troubles behind the scenes, don’t keep great achievements behind the scenes; let them see it all. Keep the server stable with minimal downtime and the players will come.

Read full topic
